episodes.title: How Our Nigerian American Love Helped Us Escape a Cult | Our Intercultural Story (Full Documentary)
episodes.description:
What happens when a proud Yoruba woman from Nigeria and an American man from South Carolina fall in love? You get a story so wild, it has to be heard to be believed.

In this episode of "Our Sweet Wahala," we sit down with Anu and Pablo from Familia PablAnu for a deeply honest and emotional conversation about their incredible journey. They share the hilarious story of how they met (it involves a headless rooster!), the cultural clashes they faced, and the massive life decisions that led them from America to Uganda, and finally to their new home in Nigeria with their five children.

But beneath the surface of their love story was a darker secret. Anu and Pablo open up for the first time about their experience with a controlling family cult, the "red flags" they missed, and the moment that led them to break free. This is a powerful story of resilience, finding your own path, and the unbreakable bond of a family determined to build a life on its own terms.

If you are in an intercultural relationship, navigating complex family dynamics, or believe in the power of starting over, this story is for you.

CHAPTERS:

0:00 - Intro & The Culture Quiz
05:10 - How We Met: The Headless Rooster
14:45 - Meeting the Parents & First Cultural Clashes
24:30 - Our Health Journey & The Move to Home Birth
48:20 - Why We Left America for Africa (The Uganda Story)
1:01:00 - The Decision to Move to Nigeria
1:12:15 - Raising Trilingual, Un-Schooled Kids in Nigeria
1:26:00 - The First Red Flags: "Something Wasn't Right"
1:38:40 - The Hijacked Wedding
1:47:00 - The Awakening: "We Are in a Cult"
1:52:10 - The Breaking Point & Finding Freedom
1:58:00 - Healing, Reconnecting & Our Final Advice
